step_of_the_day.title:
Step of the Day:
            Language unconsciously supports bad habits and can send you in the wrong direction. Strive to make your
            language positive today (Pillar #5)
step_of_the_day.content:
"Nothing is impossible, the word itself says, ‘I'm possible!\" Audrey HepburnI often hear people say, “That’s difficult\", or “I don’t know if I can do it\". These statements seem
            reasonable enough, but the words guide your psychology and behavior. Before you know it, you are headed in a
            negative direction. The issue is not whether you are right - yes, it’s difficult. The issue is where you
            place your focus. A focus on what can make a task hard creates resistance in you; a bit of hesitancy. It causes you to brace
            to the anticipated problem, obstacles, or unknown. It can even contribute to your procrastination. This is
            the opposite of being in the “flow\" which is about trusting yourself and going for it. When you do this,
            all your energy is going in the same direction. Success will be easier to achieve.

action_step:
Pay attention to your language. Make a conscious effort to think and use positive words to describe what you
            are doing or about to do. Focus on what needs to be done, not why it might be difficult or what can go
            wrong.
journal_entry: Do you focus on the positive, or what can go wrong? Write about your tendency and how it impacts you.
